intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. jaccardii, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides. The plant produces yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. This subspecies is often found in disturbed soils and can spread aggressively in certain environments.
